msbt.message: Ah, yes. You'd like to talk about our island backup service, hm?Well, firstthe service is only for use when your Nintendo Switch system has been lost or damaged.That said, how can I help you?
Enable island backup.
Listen to explanation.
I'm good right now.
Ah, yes. You'd like to talk about your island backup settings, hm?Well, island backup is currently enabled, so your island is protected even when you aren't playing.That said, how can I help you?
Disable island backup.
Listen to explanation.
I'm good right now.
So, how can I help you?
Enable island backup.
Listen to explanation.
I'm good right now.
So, how can I help you?
Disable island backup.
Listen to explanation.
I'm good right now.
I'd be happy to explain our island backup and restoration service. What would you like to learn about?
What's island backup?
When is data saved?
What's required?
How do I restore?
I'm all good.

Great question! Island backup is a way to upload your Animal Crossing: New Horizons data for safekeeping.First, the service is only for use when your Nintendo Switch system has been lost or damaged.That saidWhen island backup is enabled, your Animal Crossing: New Horizons save data will be uploaded periodically.If you have uploaded data, it can be restored later if your Nintendo Switch system is lost or damaged.You will need a new or repaired system, of course, but then you can pick up where you left off! Yes, yes!Finally, it is required to have an active Nintendo Switch Online membership to use this service.You can find more details about the island backup service on the Nintendo Support website, hm?

Ah, a question about the technical details. I'll do my best to answer!Well, if you have enabled island backup, you can rest assured that your data will be saved periodically.That said, your Nintendo Switch system must be connected to the internet for the backup to occur, hm?And, of course, you'll need an active Nintendo Switch Online membership.Assuming those details are in order, your data will be saved even when you're not playing the game.Oho! Island backup even works when your system is in sleep mode!If you're curious about when the data was last saved, just check out the title screen.The time and date of your last backup will be displayed on the lower-left side of the screen!

Yes, yesquite a relevant query! Well, I believe I can explain what you'll need to utilize island backupTo enable island backup or restore data, you must be a user who plays Animal Crossing: New Horizons.And you must have an active Nintendo Switch Online membership.Additionally, your Nintendo Switch system must be connected to the internet.Last but not least, you must have a resident enable the service. I believe that's it!

Oh, yes. That's quite important!Island backup can protect your data if your Nintendo Switch system is lost or damaged.But before data can be restored, you'll need to have the repaired system—or a replacement—ready.And you'll need a copy of Animal Crossing: New Horizons, hm?Once those are ready, the user who enabled island backup can begin the restoration process.Oh! I should mention that this same user must have an active Nintendo Switch Online membership.More info is available on the Nintendo Support website, so I do hope you'll check it out.
Can I help you with anything else?
What's island backup?
When is data saved?
What's required?
How do I restore?
I'm all good.

Of course, of course, you'd like to enable island backup? I'd be happy to help!Let me just talk you through a few items first, hm?To enable island backup or restore data, you must be a user who plays Animal Crossing: New Horizons.And you must have an active Nintendo Switch Online membership.Let's see, what elseOh! When island backup is enabled, data will be uploaded via the internet automatically.This will happen when you are not playing the game.So, are you sure you want to enable island backup?
Yep! Enable, please!
Don't do anything.
Understood! I'll enable the island backup service right away.

And there we go. Island backup has been enabled!From now on, your data will be uploaded when no one is playing the game.That is, provided your Nintendo Switch system is connected to the internet, of course.You can see the date and time of your most recent backup in the lower-left corner of the title screen.So, if you want to confirm that the service is working, please check there in the future.

I can help you with that, but let me confirm that you understand firstIf you disable island backup, you won't be able to restore your data if your system is lost or damaged.Are you sure you want to proceed?
Yes, disable backup.
Keep setting as is.
OK, I've disabled island backup for you!If you change your mind and want to re-enable island backup, you can come talk to me anytime.
Yes, yesI won't change a thing.

Ah! It seems another user was the one who originally enabled island backup on this system.I'm afraid that other user will need to be the one to disable it if necessary, .So, if you need to change this setting, please have that user come see me.

Hmmthat's strange. For some reason, I wasn't able to enable the island backup service just now.Remember, your Nintendo Switch system must be connected to the internet to enable this feature.And you must have an active Nintendo Switch Online membership as well.Once those conditions are satisfied, do please come see me again, hm? For now, let's go to the title screen.
Welcome, welcome! I'm more than happy to help you restore your island data.Before we begin, this is a serious process, so children may want to get help from a parent or guardian.
Now then, our next step is to connect to the internet and search for backup data to restore.Are you ready to check for data?
Check.
No, not right now.
OK! Let's connect to the internet and check
I found recoverable backup data on the server. The island name is .
I found recoverable backup data for multiple islands on the server.
Which island are you interested in restoring?
OK, this is the final confirmation.Are you sure you want to download and restore data for ?
Yes, please.
No.
Very well! I'll begin the download for data, and we'll get started on restoration. Yes, yes!
Understood. Do you want to see about restoring data for a different island instead?
Check.
No, not right now.
Thank you for your patience. Your island data has been restored! Now, let's restart the game.
Hmm I wasn't able to search for recoverable backup data
Hmm I couldn't find any recoverable backup data

There are a few conditions we must meet for island backup restoration to work, hm?First, your Nintendo Switch system must be connected to the internet.Next, the user who enabled island backup originally must be the one who comes to speak with me.Finally, that user must have an active Nintendo Switch Online membership.
Please visit the Nintendo Support website for more info on island backup restoration.
For now, we'll need to pause this process. Please press the HOME Button and close the game.
Oh dear The island backup restoration process seems to have failed.
Do you want to try checking again?
Check.
No, not right now.
